repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
**feat(ui): additional arguments for cmdline_show/hide events**

Problem:  Unable to tell what highlight the prompt part of a
          cmdline_show event should have, and whether cmdline_hide was
          emitted after aborting.
Solution: Add additional arguments hl_id to cmdline_show, and abort to
          cmdline_hide.

**feat(ui): specify whether msg_show event is added to history**

Pass along whether message in msg_show event is added to the internal
:messages history.

Fix #31643.

comment_data.body: Didn't think it necessary to add this to `ext_keys` and expected `ext_state`, to avoid having to add this to a bunch of existing tests. Checking this field directly instead in the added test.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -79,6 +79,7 @@ end
 --- @field win_position table<integer,table<string,integer>>
 --- @field float_pos table<integer,table>
 --- @field cmdline table<integer,table>
+--- @field cmdline_abort? boolean

comment_data.body:
Not sure I like this actually, considering doing this anyways; adding the `abort` state as a field in `self.cmdline[level]` instead.

EDIT: done.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -79,6 +79,7 @@ end
 --- @field win_position table<integer,table<string,integer>>
 --- @field float_pos table<integer,table>
 --- @field cmdline table<integer,table>
+--- @field cmdline_abort? boolean

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
• New fields/arguments in these existing UI events:
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,13 @@ EVENTS
 
 • |vim.ui_attach()| callbacks for |ui-messages| `msg_show` events are executed in
   |api-fast| context.
+• Various additions for the following UI events:

comment_data.body:
~~nit: for consistency, this should probably be `cancel`. In `:help api`, `:help lsp`, and `:help CompleteDone`, we use "cancel" in a few places and "abort" nowhere. "abort" can be useful when we want to indicate a "ungraceful exit" where state may be invalid, but I guess that's not the case here.~~

OTOH, `:help ctrl-c` mentions "interrupt" and "abort", as does `:help CmdlineLeave`. So maybe "abort" is more consistent for cmdline. Sigh...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,13 @@ EVENTS
 
 • |vim.ui_attach()| callbacks for |ui-messages| `msg_show` events are executed in
   |api-fast| context.
+• Various additions for the following UI events:
+  • `cmdline_show`: `hl_id` argument to highlight the prompt text.
+  • `cmdline_hide`: `abort` argument indicating if the cmdline was aborted.

comment_data.body: Fair, but I think that is trumped by the fact that this is analogous to the `v:event.abort` field for `CmdlineLeave`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,13 @@ EVENTS
 
 • |vim.ui_attach()| callbacks for |ui-messages| `msg_show` events are executed in
   |api-fast| context.
+• Various additions for the following UI events:
+  • `cmdline_show`: `hl_id` argument to highlight the prompt text.
+  • `cmdline_hide`: `abort` argument indicating if the cmdline was aborted.

comment_data.body:
What about:
"New/enhanced arguments in these existing UI events:`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,13 @@ EVENTS
 
 • |vim.ui_attach()| callbacks for |ui-messages| `msg_show` events are executed in
   |api-fast| context.
+• Various additions for the following UI events:

comment_data.body:
is it useful to pass the index? 
```suggestion
    ui_call_msg_show(cstr_as_string(msg_ext_kind), *tofree, msg_ext_overwrite,
                     msg_ext_history ? msg_hist_len : -1);
```

Inclined to say no, even though I'm still not sure how useful the argument itself is. Just added it because of #31643, and because @bfredl said: "I just don't see any reason to not expose it. Like it is observable state anyway, this just gives the information at an earlier time."

But since the message history is a FIFO, there is no guarantee that the message will still be at the same index when the history is inspected anyways. Unless done immediately, at which point it will simply be the last element.
